header.title: Phillip Schofield comes out as gay after 26 year marriage: 'I am feeling pain'
header.subtitle: PHILLIP SCHOFIELD has come out as gay in a lengthy statement on Instagram, after telling his wife of 26 years and two children of being consumed by his feelings.
header.postText: 'Phillip Schofield, 57, came out in a lengthy statement posted on his Instagram story, before going on to This Morning to be interviewed by his co-host Holly Willoughby, who said I will always be by your side . In view of his 2.7 million followers, the presenter, who has two daughters with his wife of nearly 27 years, Stephanie Lowe, wrote: You never know what’s going on in someone’s seemingly perfect life, what issues they are struggling with, or the state of their wellbeing - and so you won’t know what has been consuming me for the last few years.', 'With the strength and support of my wife and my daughters, I have been coming to terms with the fact that I am gay.', 'This is something that has caused many heart-breaking conversations at home.', 'I have been married to Steph for nearly 27 years, and we have two beautiful grown-up daughters, Molly and Ruby.', 'Phillip went on to thank his family for their kindness in spite of their confusion over the news.', 'He continued: My family have held me so close: they have tried to cheer me up, to smother me with kindness and love, despite their own confusion.', 'Yet I still can’t sleep and there have been some very dark moments.', ' My inner conflict contrasts with an outside world that has changed so very much for the better. ', 'Today, quite rightly, being gay is a reason to celebrate and be proud.Yes, I am feeling pain and confusion, but that comes only from the hurt that I am causing to my family.', 'Steph has been incredible - I love her so very much.She is the kindest soul I have ever met.', 'My girls have been astonishing in their love, hugs and encouraging words of comfort.Both mine and Steph’ s entire families have stunned me with their love, instant acceptance and support.', 'Of course they are worried about Steph, but I know they will scoop us both up. ', 'My friends are the best, especially Holly, who has been so kind and wise - and who has hugged me as I sobbed on her shoulder.', 'At ITV, I couldn’ t hope to work with more wonderful, supportive teams. ', ' Every day on This Morning, I sit in awe of those we meet who have been so brave and open in confronting their truth - so now it’ s my turn to share mine.', ' This will probably all come as something of a surprise and I understand, but only by facing this, by being honest, can I hope to find peace in my mind and a way forward.Please be kind, especially to my family.Phillip.', 'Phillip opened up about his announcement on This Morning today in a heartfelt appearance with Holly, who hugged him and assured him she would be by his side forever amid applause from the ITV team.', 'Holly asked her co - star how he was feeling about speaking out.', 'He said: It's funny because, everyone that I've spoken to have all been so supportive, so loving and caring.', 'My entire family, to a person, have grabbed us and said it 's okay, we love you, we're proud of you.With every person I tell, it gets a little lighter and a little lighter.', 'On how his wife is feeling, he replied: It's tough.But this is not something that has happened quickly.I 've had to deal with this in my head for quite some time., 'And so we've gone through this together, we've been honest and we've been open.', ' I can 't write in any statement what I feel about that woman. She is amazing. She's incredible.I have never in my life, there is nobody in my life who would have supported me the way, as a wife, the way she has supported me.She 's astonishing.', 'His co-star went on to ask why he decided to speak out today.', 'He replied: It's a good question.The thing is that.You know this has been bothering me for a very long time.I think everybody does these things at their own speed in their own time. There 's no question that it has in recent times, consumed my head and has become an issue in my head.', 'And so I got to the stage where I thought, we sit here, every day, and I'm over there and some amazingly brave, incredible person is sitting here and I 'm listening to their story and thinking, Oh my God, you're so brave.And I 'm thinking: I have to be that person.', 'All you can be is honest with yourself. And I was getting to the point where I knew I wasn't being honest with myself.I was getting to the point where I didn 't like myself very much because I wasn't being honest with myself.', 'And so, when is the right time? As a family, it is the right time.', 'Holly then quizzed Phillip about a potential new partner in the future.', 'He added: I’m doing each day at a time, this has always been a slow process. There is no fast process after this.', 'Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford shared their support to the star in the studio today.', 'The married couple hugged Phillip as Holly teared up.', ' Eamonn then said to the presenter: I’m disappointed in a couple of ways.', ' First of all, I heard it was a big announcement from Phillip - I thought you were going to come in and announce you had resigned and I would get the job!But that wasn’ t to be. ', 'As the team laughed, Eamonn launched into his second joke, saying: And the second is...there 's this great imponderable in life that has always irritated me.', 'Britain's Got Talent and I 'm a Celebrity stars Ant McPartlin and Declan Donnelly said they are sending love to Phillip after he was announced he was gay.', 'In a tweet the multi-award winning presenters said: Huge respect and admiration for our friend @Schofe. Sending love to you P, and to your 3 lovely girls.', 'The tweet comes after famous faces ranging from Peter Andre to Martin Lewis have come out in support of Phil.', 'Following his annoucement, many other celebrities have flocked to social media to comment, including The Chase star Jenny Ryan.', 'She wrote on Twitter: Huge love for @Schofe and his family today.', 'This can't have been an easy statement to write, but it will be a huge weight off their shoulders - and it will open up dialogue all over the country.', 'Maybe one day it won't be so hard or painful for *anyone* to come out.'

commentThread.commentText: I just want to come out now and tell people I am heterosexual.  It is so difficult for me to tell everyone I am different to them.

replies.commentText: Me to

Your statement is unnecessary and a waste of the data used to post it but i'mi guessing that's probably par for the course with most of what you drone on about. You see there is no need to come out as straight because that is the assumption that people will generally make about you.Whereas LGBTQ + people will generally have to come out many times throughout their lives, and each time wonder or fear the reaction and the consequences they may have to live with such as being disowned by family and friends Your crass comment, together with your minions chipping in below only goes to show why people, in this case Phillip Schofield, don 't come out.

Hang in there brother, we are all behind you on this. Sending you virtual hugs. And just remember, it's no one else's business if you prefer to sleep with a woman. People shouldn't judge you for your natural emotions, even if yours are now seen as rare.
Don't feel bad about it .The world will soon accept that it's  normal and you are not in the minority. !

replies.commentText: My dear Mr Ukfreedom, Let's not fall into the trap of feeling sorry for women. This is no place for such Woke Logic. If she appears supportive and loyal it's because she's desperate to cling to what she thought they had, but it will eventually dawn on her when he starts to live the life he wants without her. Stephen Fry once claimed he was celibate, saying the thought of two sweaty bodies clambering over each other repulsed him - then he tried it, and found himself a toyboy!

replies.commentText: I was more surprised that he got married, as it was obvious it wasn't really right for him. His wife must have been very naive indeed not to know or have an inkling. Not surprised at all that he 's now come out.  But he gets no points for his selfishness and deceit for almost 3 decades. His poor wife will be inevitably reviewing her entire life with him, from the times they were in bed to what he was really thinking of when he touched her and when he decided he wanted men. She 'll be supportive ofc, at least for now, until as with Barrymore's wife she eventually disconnects from the sham and lies she 's been conditioned to accept out of loyalty and albeit fractured sense of belonging.  I hope she makes it through the other side and has someone looking out for her.

I feel for his wife too,she wonder what their marriage really meant?

You are surprised because you have absolutely no concept whatsoever, about what society was like growing up in the sixties. Homosexuality wasn't decriminalised until 1967. So with the greatest respect you have spouted utter nonsense in both your posts, because you are judging the past with today's outlook on life. My brother is gay and I saw firsthand  what he went through. For decades he couldn't come out as gay, as it would have cost him his job, so gay men got married! As is 'still the case' in the  less enlightened ethnic parts of UK society.
so to keep his job he got married?

"You are surprised because you have absolutely no concept whatsoever, about what society was like growing up in the sixties." Bad day eh ? Firstly, I said I WASN 'T surprised. Secondly, actually I do know what is was like to grow up in the 60 's. Third, Schofield is in his 50 's so was just a CHILD in the 60's. Fourth, do the maths - he married 26 years ago, which is 1994, so well after as you said, homosexuality was decriminalised in the late 60 's.  Being 'openly gay ' exploded in the 80's helped by the music scene Boy George, Frankie, George Michael, Freddy.I was there too! The town where I live has been a 'gay' refuge since the 50 's. I have gay friends, including one trans and my youngest child is gay, so please, save your ignorant jibes for someone else.  My good friend told me how hard it was in the 50 's being gay, and the turning point really was the 60's and he ended up coming to where I live which he said was like a new world.He 's in his late 60's and married to a young man now I went to their wedding.He used to work on the stage for many years with many stars of the theatre / shows, many not with us now. My comments are entirely in support of Phil 's wife, and I stand by calling him arrogant and selfish. How dare he USE another person as his shield!His poor wife wasted 3 decades apparently unknowingly living HIS lie and preserving HIS 'secret' that everyone knew anyway!so he could USE her to play happy families Such arrogance and self - entitlement..
Philip Schofield wasn't even a glint in his father's eye in the sixties.

Nothing to do with 'homophobia' at all. It 's much more to do with respecting the feelings of the woman who he has deceived for so long and the effect on the children he has had with her. What he claims to be is of no interest to anyone - it 's how he has treated other people that is to be criticised.

He's already done it virtue signalled by saying "Today, quite rightly, being gay >is a reason to celebrate and be proud." No it's not, any more than being hetrosexual is a reason to celibrate and be proud. This is a private matter and should not be blasted all over the media in this way.

Its the number one item on Sky News: All with dodgy female presenters of course.

Too late, we've already seen how he is now 'celebrating' his alleged long repressed sexuality and taking 'pride' in it. He had choices, nobody forced him to get married or stay in a marriage for 26 years. As is common, he 's diverting blame from himself using the 'poor me ' approach so he can salve his conscience if he has one, not sure that he does, as someone staying in a 26 year marriage and deceiving another human being to live in denial is not a person with a conscience - it's a person in fear of exploring his s3xuality, albeit in a time of widespread acceptance.
Unless she's known all along and has ways of her own.

If his wife didn't know, then why did he say in his big speech when thanking his family for their support:  "despite their own confusion" ? The entire marriage occurred within an era of widespread acceptance of homosexuality, so he had no reason to enter this marriage, at all and did so for purely selfish reasons.

commentThread.commentText: Well, I for one have had a blast with this one....lots of witty Rep-R-Tea been posted.

Who cares about your bedroom habits? Who is interested? As far as I am concerned you do a good job of presenting get on well with Holly and that is that. I did not know you had grown up daughters, irrelevant to me, as is your mid life change of sexuality. On that note why say anything to anyone in the public? I can only guess the gutter press got wind of it, so you thought you had no choice
Has he been drinking soya milk?
John Lennon's words on entertainment ring true!
Never liked the bloke to be honest. But credit to him for this enormously brave move. I hope he finds his peace.

replies.commentText: Brave?! Brave is crawling across a battlefield under enemy fire to pull one's wounded comrade to safety. Brave is charging into a burning building to rescue a child, brave is a schoolchild standing up to bullies to protect a friend. Brave is NOT a man who drags his loved ones through hell and humiliation by lying to them and himself about who he is.

Yes, yes it is all of the above. But so is going into battle against your own demons, at 3 am - night after night.Never knowing whether this will be the night they finally win.And doubtless he has had this for the best part of 27 years.So to finally confront it head on and come clean to the entire nation in full view of the media is also brave.You are obviously very lucky to have avoided this struggle.
No excuse for the pain he's caused his family. He should never have married a woman in the first place. Did he marry for love or a beard?
Who is he?

commentThread.commentText: You would have to be gay >to sit next to Holly on a daily basis without a permanent boner!!

Are the ratings going down or what?
Now if Holly comes out as being lesbian, that is a sure fire ratings winner!

We right-wing, leave voting, xenophobic, white heterosexual males must make a stand against diversity. Women who are fat or ugly should also not be tolerated. When oh when will common sense prevail in this country ?

Well Phil, whilst you have been 'professionally' confused for the past 30 years, some of us were fighting for the kind of equality that makes it easier for you to 'come out' and keep your job.......a little thank you would have been nice!
